channel.title: Why does it say that my server is already in use?
channel.description: I have not the slightest idea on why my server will not run because it's apparently already in use.. I've tried running the task manager and stopping the javaw.exe and it wasn't running... :confused: :confused: :confused:

item.title: Why does it say that my server is already in use?
item.dc:creator: @The_Provoked The Provoked
item.description:
@The_Provoked wrote:

Ok, I downloaded the port check tool and the static ip tool, and did both, I set up a static Ip, and checked the port 43594 under TCP and it said it could not connect to portforward servers. but i checked it under UDP and it said it was open. then I looked for my router and all it did was bring me to the portforward buying software page…

so any ideas on what to do about why my server is already in use?

Read full topic
item.source: Why does it say that my server is already in use?

item.title: Why does it say that my server is already in use?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

If you can portforward correctly, you don’t need uTorrent at all.
http://portforward.com/english/routers/port_forwarding/routerindex.htm
Find your router and follow the default guide.

Read full topic

item.title: Why does it say that my server is already in use?
item.dc:creator: @w-e_s-l_e-y w-e_s-l_e-y@hotmail.com
item.description:
@w-e_s-l_e-y wrote:

You don’t have to uninstall it…

Follow this:
Options -> preferences -> connections

Here it will tell you the port uTorrent is using at the moment. Just tell it to use a port, but not 43594…

Read full topic

item.source: Why does it say that my server is already in use?

item.title: Why does it say that my server is already in use?
item.dc:creator: @sriahciboon sriahciboon
item.description:
@sriahciboon wrote:

Hey, [quote=“bluescapepkz, post:6, topic:348122”]It says your server is already in use because you’re running an application that uses port 43594 (probably another rsps or utorrent/bittorrent)[/quote]

I garuntee this is it…

Look in the bottom right corner of your screen, your going to see a couple small boxes, the time ect.

Look for U-torrent/Bittorent or 7zip. Its goign to be some kind of file hosting application.

Good luck
-Sriahciboon

Read full topic
item.source: Why does it say that my server is already in use?

item.title: Why does it say that my server is already in use?
item.dc:creator: @w-e_s-l_e-y w-e_s-l_e-y@hotmail.com
item.description:
@w-e_s-l_e-y wrote:

The server is already in use, means that another programm is using the port your server is trying to use.
A port is like a small door. Your router has a lot of those small doors. As you might know only one person can enter a door. Two people can’t enter a door together, so two programms can’t use the same port.

Try to look for a programm that is using the port, wich is most of the time 43594 like The Provoked said (it can also be other ports). Torrentdownloaders are using ports to enter the internet, they sometimes use port 43594, so check for it!

I hope this helps you understanding a little bit more about your error.

Good luck.

Read full topic
item.source: Why does it say that my server is already in use?
